summary: The Ethics in Energy Act of 2025 aims to prevent covered utilities from charging ratepayers for expenses related to political influence activities. The bill defines covered utilities and expenses, including lobbying, advertising, and contributions to organizations. It mandates the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to establish regulations and reporting requirements to enforce the prohibition. The bill also outlines penalties for non-compliance, with funds distributed to ratepayers and the FERC, emphasizing transparency in utility spending.
